qas.question: What 3 video formats did the 360 support natively at launch?

answers.text: Windows Media Video (WMV) format (including high-definition and PlaysForSure videos), as well as H.264 and MPEG-4

qas.question: Support for what video format was added in 2007?
How are music player controls accessed by 360 users?
What is one feature of 360 photo slide shows?
What did the 2007 update remove support for?
When was the visual synthesizer added?
Which type of WMV videos do not work on the Xbox 360?
How do gamers play videos while playing games?

context: The Xbox 360 supports videos in <a0_0>Windows Media Video (WMV) format (including <b6_0>high-definition and PlaysForSure<b6_0/> videos), as well as H.264 and MPEG-4<a0_0/> media. The <b5_0>December 2007<b5_0/> dashboard update added support for the playback of <a1_0><b4_0>MPEG-4 ASP<b4_0/><a1_0/> format videos. The console can also display pictures and perform slideshows of photo collections with various <a3_0>transition effects<a3_0/>, and supports audio playback, with music player controls accessible through <a2_0><b7_0>the Xbox 360 Guide button<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Users may play back their own music while playing games or using the dashboard, and can play music with an interactive visual synthesizer.
